newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY CUSTOMS SEIZE CIGARETTES WORTH $1 MLN.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY CUSTOMS SEIZE CIGARETTES WORTH $1 MLN.

text.p: Hungarian customs officials seized over 80,000 cartons of American cigarettes worth $1 million hidden in two Macedonian-registered trucks on the Hungarian-Yugoslav border, an offical said Thursday.
"The cigarettes were discovered in two refigerated trucks, one which came through the border post of Roszke yesterday morning and one yesterday evening," customs spokesman Jeno Sipo told Reuters.
The first truck was carrying frozen peppers and the second a consignment of apples, he said.
Customs officials' suspicions had been raised by the fact that the goods, which were bound for Germany, were not being kept at freezing temperatures.
"We were suspicious when we discovered the cargoes were being carried at zero degrees and not colder," he said.
The two drivers, both with Macedonian passports, were being held pending further investigation, Sipos said.
